overview: The purpose and intent of this measure is to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund and repeal two existing conference center funds (HB1169_SD2). The University of Hawai‘i (UH) supports HB 1169 HD1 SD1, which will establish the fund and accounts to "facilitate the administration of the fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the UH system" (HB1169_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-28-25_). The Committee on Ways and Means finds that a single revolving fund will "help to standardize conference center programs across all campuses of the University of Hawaii System and facilitate the administration of conference center moneys" (HB1169_SD2).
policy_impact: The Committee on Ways and Means has amended this measure by "(1) Clarifying the permissible uses of moneys appropriated from the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund; and (2) Making technical nonsubstantive amendments for purposes of clarity, consistency, and style" (HB1169_SD2). The committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, as amended (HB1169_SD2). It now recommends that the bill pass Third Reading in the form of H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2 (HB1169_SD2).
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The bill has progressed to the Senate Committee on Ways and Means, which received testimony in support from the University of Hawai‘i's Vice President for Budget and Finance/Chief Financial Officer (HB1169_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-28-25_). The primary update is that the Committee on Ways and Means has amended the measure by "Clarifying the permissible uses of moneys appropriated from the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund" and making other technical amendments (HB1169_SD2). Consequently, the committee recommends that the bill, now designated as H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, pass Third Reading (HB1169_SD2).
